artist: Ōta Masamitsu; Carver: Nagai Otokichi; Printer: Itō Harutarō
inscription:
on the attached paper:
Review of the print by Wakiya Mitsunobu
Carver:Nagai Otokichi
Printer:Ito_ Shuntaro_
Producer:Miyake Yo_zo_
medium: Woodblock print, ink and color on paper
portfolio: Figures on the Stage in the Shōwa Period (Shōwa butai sugata 昭和舞台姿)
text: Actor Ichikawa Ennosuke II (1888-1963) in the premiere of the play Akutarō in June 1924 at the Ichimura Theater, Tokyo. Akutarō (literally bad boy) regularly drinks too much and then behaves badly like when he threatens his uncle with a halberd (naginata) for more sake.
title: No. 8, Actor Ichikawa Ennosuke II as Akutarō
